results.title: Vaughan Williams: a London symphony - Scherzo (Nocturne) (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”
The sights, sounds and feelings of London at night aptly illustrate the third movement of Vaughan Williams’ London Symphony. The fountain at Marble Arch, pigeons in Trafalgar Square, moving traffic, flickering neon signs, a Cockney blowing on a mouth-organ, are contrasted with the dignity and tradition of the House of Parliament, and the evening mist and sunset along the Thames Embankment. Includes a Study Guide.

results.title: Mozart: Symphony No. 41 in C Major, Menuetto Allegretto (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion Series”.
A series of abstrzct scenes of nature in a variety of rhythms, moods and tempos give added significance to the music in Mozart’s Minuet from the “Jupiter” Symphony.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Beethoven, Symphony No. 8 in F Major (Tempo Di Minueto -3rd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Beethoven often found his musical motives and themes in scenes of nature; scenes of the peacefully flowing Rhine river, ruined castles, leaves turning in the sun, an open field of grain express the charm and individuality of this movement of Beethoven’s Eight Symphony. No other credits are available.

results.title: Allegro molto from the symphony No.5 in E flat by Jean Sibelius
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the granitic hardness and glacial sparkle of Finland describe part of the Fifth Symphony of Sibelius. Snow-capped mountains and trees reflected in deep blue lakes, falling snow in a dense evergreen forest, sunny snow-banks of a glacier reflect the composer’s changing moods from strong unrelenting harmonies to soft tremolos and pizzicato passages. (A study guide is available with this film). From the “Music in motion” series.

results.title: The Voices of a string quartet
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier, Arts and Audiences and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Introduces the instruments of the string quartet and indicates their similarities and differences. Presents selections in a variety of moods, including musical imitations of brasses, organ and harp. Performing artists: The Juilliard String Quartet.

results.title: The Elements of composition
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Defines and explains melody, harmony, rhythm and counterpoint to a young audience. Each element is illustrated by the New York Woodwind Quintet. The film emphasises that melody is full of character, the addition of harmony makes music complete, rhythm is of many kinds and can be felt and listening to counterpoint is like following a conversation. Summarises and contrasts the elements of composition through the playing of a harmonic, rhythmic and contrapuntal treatment of the melody. Script by Lydia Perera
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier and Dynamic Films
